relation: IEC version. A value of 1 indicates the Cisco IOS Release 12.3(4)T version.
Network physical entity (hardware system) that generated the IEC. The value 1 is assigned to the gateway.
Error category, defined in terms of ITU-based Q.850 cause codes and VoIP network errors.
Specific subsystem within the physical entity where the IEC was generated.
Cisco internal diagnostic value. Report this value to Cisco Technical Support.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Voice Command Reference - S commands - show vdev through show voice statistics memory-usage [Support] - Cisco
title: Table 21 show voice iec description Field Descriptions
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {429584=This command was modified. The summary keyword was added for the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series. Theds0-group argument was added for the Cisco MC3810., 50586=Cisco 827, Cisco 1700 Series, and Cisco 7750 with Analog Voice Ports, 57961=Cisco 2600, Cisco 3600, and Cisco 3700 Series with Digital Voice Ports (with T1 Packet Voice Trunk Network Modules), 282528=The following example shows the details of the DSP errors on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router., 452573=If the FXO port 0/2/0 is disconnected, the output of the show voice portcommand changes so that the Administrative State remains "UP" but the Operation State is "DOWN." Beginning in Cisco IOS Release 15.1(3)T, there is improved status monitoring of FXO ports--any time an FXO port is connected or disconnected, a message is displayed to indicate the status change. For example, the following message is displayed to report that a cable has been connected, and the status is changed to "up" for FXO port 0/2/0: 000118: Jul 14 18:06:05.122 EST: %LINK-3-UPDOWN: Interface Foreign Exchange Office 0/2/0, changed state to operational status up due to cable reconnection, 97785=Codec, 428390=This command was modified. The ds0-group argument was added for the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series., 434085=The ds0-group command automatically creates a logical voice port that is numbered as follows on Cisco 2600, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 7200 series routers: slot / port : ds0-group-number. Although only one voice port is created for each group, applicable calls are routed to any channel in the group., 281126=The following example shows the channel capabilities of the different types of codecs on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router:, 430468=This command was modified. This command was implemented for direct inward dial (DID) on the Cisco IAD2420 series., 74204=The show voice call command does not display the codec and VAD fields because this information is in the summary display. If you use the show voice call statuscommand by itself, an immediate list of all the active calls is shown. You can use the call-id argument to request that the DSP associated with the call-id be queried for run-time statistics twice, once immediately, and a second time after sample seconds., 430832=This command was modified. Support for enhanced Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) voice gateway interoperability was added to Cisco CallManager Version 3.1 for the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco Gateway 200 (Cisco VG200)., 265953=The following sample output shows the current status of the codec, set for modem relay, on channel 1:, 431325=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(11)T and Cisco CallManager Version 3.2. It was implemented on the Cisco IAD2420 series., 243922=Codec mask associated with the session., 126105=Media negotiation failure due to non existing codec, 53850=Cisco 2600 Series, Cisco 3600 Series, Cisco 3700 Series with Analog Voice Ports, 280492=The following output shows the active channels on SPA-DSP located in slot 1 of the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router:, 34881=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series., 263562=The show voice dsp group all command output was modified for SPA-DSP on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router., 260661=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 Series and Cisco 3600 Series, and the display format was modified., 67522=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series., 398380=Codec type used for this call., 419922=Cisco 2600 and Cisco 3600 Series Router with Digital Voice Ports, 243814=Codec Mask, 81102=Beginning in Cisco IOS Release 15.1(3)T, there is improved status monitoring of FXO ports--any time an FXO port is connected or disconnected, a message is displayed to indicate the status change. For example, the following message is displayed to report that a cable has been connected, and the status is changed to "up" for FXO port 0/2/0: 000118: Jul 14 18:06:05.122 EST: %LINK-3-UPDOWN: Interface Foreign Exchange Office 0/2/0, changed state to operational status up due to cable reconnection, 83475=The output from the show voice call summary command is slightly different in the PORT field on platforms other than the Cisco AS5350, Cisco AS5400, and Cisco AS5850. The contrast between platform types is as follows: Platform Regular PRI (T1) NFAS PRI (T1)* -------------------------------------------------------------- non-AS5xxx 3/0:23.TS 3/1:23.TS AS5xxx 3/0:D.TS Ser3/1:(TS-1) * Assumes T1 3/1 is a member of an NFAS group with T1 3/0 as the primary NFAS member, and TS is the time slot counted from a base of 1 (for example 1, 2, 3)., 298947=Codec Type, 97888=Codec., 278884=The following sample output shows the DSP Type, DSP number, channel number, codecs running, DSP firmware version, and current state of the channels running on the SPA-DSP inside the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router:, 267900=The following is a sample output of this command on a Cisco 1750 router:, 263228=This command was implemented on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router., 72002=If no call is active on a voice port, the show voice call summary command displays only the VPM (shutdown) state. If a call is active on a voice port, the show voice call summary command displays voice telephony service provider (VTSP) state. For an on-net call or a local call without local bypass (not cross-connected), the codec and voice activity detection (VAD) fields are displayed. For an off-net call or a local call with local bypass, the codec and VAD fields are not displayed., 417476=Cisco 2600 and Cisco 3600 Series Router with Analog Voice Ports, 261725=The command was modified. The command output was enhanced to display the codec setting for modem relay operation., 87789=The following is sample output from the show voice call statuscommand on the Cisco 2600 series. You can use this command rather than the show call active briefcommand to obtain the caller ID; the caller ID output of the show voice call statuscommand is already in hexadecimal form., 416449=Cisco 1750 Router, 264354=Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description { slot/port } show vdev To display information about the digital signal processors (DSPs) on a specific card, use the show vdev command in privileged EXEC mode. show vdev show voice statistics memory-usage show voice statistics interval-tag show voice statistics iec show voice statistics csr since-reset all show voice statistics csr since-reset aggregation-level show voice statistics csr since-reset accounting show voice statistics csr interval aggregation show voice statistics csr interval accounting show voice source-group show voice port show voice permanent-call show voice pcm capture show voice lmr show voice iec description show voice hpi capture show voice enum-match-table show voice eddri prefix show voice dsp summary show voice dsp crash-dump show voice dsp channel show voice dsp show voice dsmp stream show voice dnis-map show voice data show voice connectivity summary show voice class uri show voice class resource-group show voice class phone-proxy show voice class
textAfterTable: Release Modification 12.3(2)T This command was introduced on the Cisco AS5850. Usage Guidelines This command can be used on the standby and active route switch controller (RSC) to verify that dynamic and bulk synchronization have been performed correctly on a specified port. Examples The following example shows the output for the last port on a 324 universal port card.  Router# show vdev 2/323 flags = 0x0000 dev_status = 0x0000 service = 0x0000 service_type = 0x0 min_speed = 0, max_speed = 0 modulation = 0, err_correction = 0, compression = 0 csm_call_info = 0x0, csm_session = Invalid vdev_p set to modem_info DSPLIB information: dsplib_state = 0x0 dsplib_next_action = 0x0 HDLC information: call_id = 0x0 called_number = speed = 0 ces = 0x0 spc = FALSE d_idb = 0x0 Bulk sync reference = 2, Global bulk syncs = 2 The table below displays significant fields shown in the output. Table 1 show vdev Field Descriptions Field
